definition: to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag

sentences.english: Many American statestaunttout themselves as fishing and hunting paradises, and with good reason.
sentences.chinese: 许多美国州自诩是钓鱼打猎的天堂，而且理由很充分。

sentences.english: Blair was a self-styled regular guy with buckets of charm.
sentences.chinese: 布莱尔风度翩翩，自诩为受欢迎的人。
组织者自诩此次演出为“毕生难逢的体验”。

sentences.english: Saddam, who bragged that the Babylonian lion on behalf of Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 萨达姆自诩为巴比伦的雄狮在此代表伊拉克。

sentences.english: China boasts that more countries are taking part in Shanghai's Expo than any in history.
sentences.chinese: 中国自诩上海世博会参展国数史上第一。

sentences.english: They love to boast, though often with tongue in cheek. P. 3
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢吹嘘自诩，尽管往往是半开玩笑，不可当真。

sentences.english: It is time for the CPC who boast himself to be great, glorious and correct to wake up.
sentences.chinese: 忠言逆耳，一贯自诩伟大光荣正确的中共，该醒了。

sentences.english: She poses as an expert in old coins.
The man boasted himself to be of noble origin.
Well,some of them claimed to be by apostles.
sentences.chinese: 它们中有些自诩为使徒所写。

definition: to consider oneself as/to believe oneself to be
to consider oneself to be (sth positive)
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
